alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 11:21PM EDT until July 29 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan, Knox, Leslie, Letcher and Perry. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 PM EDT, flooding is occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlan, Cumberland, Loyall, Evarts, Lynch, Benham, Wallins Creek, Rosspoint, Golden Ash, Kitts, Clovertown, Harlan Gas, Coxton, Baxter, Ages, Sunshine, Tway, Chevrolet, Putney and Elcomb.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
